_comment: The deserializer only looks for specifically named elements, and ignores all others. So, go wild with comments.

input._count: NOTE: For this recipe type, this will fail to deserialize if not set to 1, and thus is redundant, because Cutting Boards only cut one item at a time, and count defaults to 1 if not present.
input._meta: TODO: Have gotta find out a way of reliably checking if a given metadata value maps to anything tangible on the corresponding ItemStack or Block.

tool._comment: TODO: I REALLY need to consider how tool capabilities are determined in-code. Maybe after I get the rest of the infrastructure up.

_comment2: Yes, this is an array. Making it an object for this recipe type would be tearing-my-legs-off-entirely levels of footgun

results._comment: Making this a container type is honestly the least duplicative way to go about this atm (also allows layered effects and chances, if people are that invested or deranged)

results._meta: For this recipe type, this will fail to deserialize if set to -1, because it's illogical to try to match all metadata values for an output.
